column1: #Text=[0335] It was found that, in the configuration of the present embodiment, there is a strong correlation between the light exit angle of light emitted from the light source and the illumination position of that light, which would not be found in conventional lighting devices.
#Text=And, in this configuration, the light exit angle dependence of this spectrum is visually perceived as chromaticity unevenness at the illuminated surface.
#Text=This problem is specific to the present configuration.
#Text=It was found that, to reduce such light exit angle dependence of the spectrum of the light source, providing a light diffusing layer between the first lens and the light source is preferred.

#Text=[0336] Note that, however, when the haze value is large, the effect of reducing the periphery coloring is achieved, although decrease of the uniformity of the illuminated surface and decrease of the sharpness of the perimeter edge portion occur.
#Text=[0337] Effective characteristics of the diffusing layer in the light spreading characteristics of this method were evaluated.
#Text=As a result, it was proved that setting the haze value to a value in the range of 5% to 50% is preferred.

#Text=[0338] When the haze value is set to a value in the range of 5% to 30%, the effect of removing the color irregularity across the illumination region can also be achieved concurrently with removal of the periphery coloring.
#Text=[0339] Note that the "haze value" is a value indicative of the "degree of haze".
